summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons incident report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 9, 2019. It details an attempted introduction of contraband (drugs) by a female visitor to an inmate in the Special Housing Unit visiting room. The inmate was placed on dry cell status, and the visitor was detained, questioned, and released.

events.title: Attempted Contraband Introduction at MCC
events.description: A female visitor attempted to pass an unknown object (suspected drugs) to inmate LT during a visit in the 9 South/Special Housing Unit Visiting Room. Staff intervened, escorted the inmate, and detained the visitor.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
9 South Visiting Room / Special Housing Unit Visiting Room, MCC New York
keyFacts: On August 9, 2019, at approximately 1:37-1:40 PM, a female visitor attempted to pass an unknown object from her waistband to inmate LT in the MCC New York visiting room.
Inmate LT was placed on 'dry cell status' following the incident, a protocol for monitoring inmates suspected of internally concealing contraband.
During a subsequent urinalysis test, inmate LT was observed pouring water into the testing cup, indicating an attempt to tamper with the sample.
The female visitor was detained and questioned by staff but was later released; no staff injuries were reported.
The incident was formally documented as an 'Attempt Introduction' of drugs (Prohibited Act Code 111A) in a Bureau of Prisons Incident Report.
